New Records: LaMelo Ball joined Steph Curry as the second NBA player to record 30+ 3-pointers in his team's first six games of the season.
Key Match Events: LaMelo Ball scored 36 points on 15-of-26 shooting, including six 3-pointers, four rebounds, six assists, and three steals.
Jayson Tatum led the Celtics with 29 points, making 14-of-17 free throws.
The Hornets had a 17-2 run in the third quarter, reducing Boston's lead from 18 points to three.
Post-Match Reflections: Hornets Head Coach Charles Lee expressed satisfaction with the team's competitive level in the second half, despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brandon Miller returned to the court after missing four games and scored 16 points with four rebounds and six assists.
The Hornets struggled with fouls, allowing Boston to make 25-of-28 free throws compared to Charlotte's 6-of-9.
